trans-unit.source: Activity: Headband charades and starry starry night
trans-unit.target: アクティビティ: Headband charades and starry starry night

trans-unit.source: /static/courses/csintro/arrays/starry-night.png
trans-unit.target: /static/courses/csintro/arrays/starry-night.png

trans-unit.source: Starry Night
trans-unit.target: Starry Night

trans-unit.source: Create an array of words that can be used as part of a charades-type game.
trans-unit.target: Create 配列 of words that can be used as part of a charades-type game.

trans-unit.source: This activity is based on a very popular phone app invented by Ellen DeGeneres (https://bits.blogs.nytimes.com/2013/05/03/ellen-degeneres-iphone-game/).
trans-unit.target: This アクティビティ is based on a very popular phone app invented by Ellen DeGeneres (https://bits.blogs.nytimes.com/2013/05/03/ellen-degeneres-iphone-game/).

trans-unit.source: /static/courses/csintro/arrays/headband-charades.png
trans-unit.target: /static/courses/csintro/arrays/headband-charades.png

trans-unit.source: Heads up game
trans-unit.target: Heads up game

trans-unit.source: Create a new variable and give it a name like arrayWords.
trans-unit.target: Create a new variable and give it a name like arrayWords.

trans-unit.source: Insert a 'set' variable block into the 'on start' block.
trans-unit.target: Insert a 「変数を・・・にする（set item）」ブロック into the 「最初だけ（on start）」 block.

trans-unit.source: Change the default variable name to this new variable name.
trans-unit.target: Change the default variable name to this new variable name.

trans-unit.source: From the Array Toolbox drawer, drag a 'create array' block to the coding workspace.
trans-unit.target: From 配列 Toolbox drawer, drag a 「この値で配列を作成（create array with number）」 block to コーディング ワークスペース.

trans-unit.source: Attach this array block to the end of the 'set' variable block.
trans-unit.target: Attach this 配列ブロック to the end of the 「変数を・・・にする（set item）」ブロック.

trans-unit.source: let arrayWords = ["", ""]
trans-unit.target: let arrayWords = ["", ""]

trans-unit.source: Notice that the array comes with 2 string blocks. We’ll want more for our charades game.
trans-unit.target: Notice that 配列 comes with 2 string blocks. We’ll want more for our charades game.

trans-unit.source: Click on the blue gear-wheel icon in the top left corner of the 'create array' block.
trans-unit.target: Click on the blue gear-wheel icon in 左上隅 of the 「この値で配列を作成（create array with number）」 block.

trans-unit.source: From the pop up window, add as many values (elements) as you'd like to the array block by dragging the value block from the left side of the window to the array block on the right side of the window.
trans-unit.target: From the pop up window, add as many values (elements) as you'd like to the 配列ブロック by dragging 値 block from the left side of the window to the 配列ブロック on the right side of the window.

trans-unit.source: For now, we’ll add 4 more values for a total of 6 values.
trans-unit.target: For now, we’ll add 4 more values for a total of 6 values.

trans-unit.source: /static/courses/csintro/arrays/array-add-value.png
trans-unit.target: /static/courses/csintro/arrays/array-add-value.png

trans-unit.source: Add values to array
trans-unit.target: Add values to array

trans-unit.source: Drag 4 string blocks from the Text Toolbox drawer, and place them in the empty array slots.
trans-unit.target: Drag 4 string blocks from the 文字列(Text)メニュー, and place them in the empty array slots.

trans-unit.source: Fill each string with one word. Choose words that will be fun for a game of charades. Example:
trans-unit.target: Fill each string with one word. Choose words that will be fun for a game of charades. Example:

trans-unit.source: let arrayWords = ["cat", "guitar", "flashlight", "cupcake", "tree", "frisbee"]
trans-unit.target: let arrayWords = ["cat", "guitar", "flashlight", "cupcake", "tree", "frisbee"]

trans-unit.source: Now, we need a way to access one word at a time from this array of words.
trans-unit.target: Now, we need a way to access one word at a time from this array of words.

trans-unit.source: We can use the 'show string' block from the Basic Toolbox drawer, and the 'on screen up' event handler from the Input Toolbox drawer (this is a drop-down menu choice of the 'on shake' block) to tell the micro:bit to display a word when we tilt the micro:bit up.
trans-unit.target: We can use the 「文字列を表示（show string）」 block from the 基本（Basic）メニュー, and the 'on screen up' イベントハンドラー from the 入力(Input)メニュー (this is a ドロップダウン メニュー choice of the 'on shake' block) to tell the micro:bit to display a word when we tilt the micro:bit up.

trans-unit.source: For this version, we’ll display the words one at a time in the order they were first placed into the array.
trans-unit.target: For this version, we’ll display the words one at a time in the order they were first placed into 配列.

trans-unit.source: We’ll use the index of the array to keep track of what word to display at any given time, so you'll need to create an 'index' variable.
trans-unit.target: We’ll use the index of 配列 to keep track of what word to display at any given time, so you'll need to create an 'index' variable.

trans-unit.source: To start the game with the index at zero, add a 'set' variable block to the 'on' start block.
trans-unit.target: To start the game with the index at zero, add a 「変数を・・・にする（set item）」ブロック to the 'on' start block.

trans-unit.source: Next, add the following:
trans-unit.target: Next, add the following:

trans-unit.source: an image as a placeholder for when the program has started. Since charades is a guessing game, we made one that looks like a question mark (?),
trans-unit.target: 画像 as a placeholder for when the program has started. Since charades is a guessing game, we made one that looks like a question mark (?),

trans-unit.source: a countdown to the first word using show number blocks and pause blocks
trans-unit.target: a countdown to the first word using show number blocks and pause blocks

trans-unit.source: And show the first word in the array
trans-unit.target: And show the first word in 配列

trans-unit.source:
let index = 0 let arrayWords: string[] = []
arrayWords = ["cat", "guitar", "flashlight", "cupcake", "tree", "frisbee"] index = 0 basic.showLeds(` .
trans-unit.target:
let index = 0 let arrayWords: string[] = []
arrayWords = ["cat", "guitar", "flashlight", "cupcake", "tree", "frisbee"] index = 0 basic.showLeds(` .

trans-unit.source: `) basic.pause(100) basic.showNumber(3) basic.pause(100) basic.showNumber(2) basic.pause(100) basic.showNumber(1) basic.showString(arrayWords[index])
trans-unit.target: `) basic.pause(100) basic.showNumber(3) basic.pause(100) basic.showNumber(2) basic.pause(100) basic.showNumber(1) basic.showString(arrayWords[index])

trans-unit.source: So far we have a start to our game and a way to display the first word.
trans-unit.target: So far we have a start to our game and a way to display the first word.

trans-unit.source: Once that word has been guessed (or passed), we need a way to advance to the next word in the array.
trans-unit.target: Once that word has been guessed (or passed), we need a way to advance to the next word in 配列.

trans-unit.source: We can do this by changing the index of the array with the 'on screen down' event handler from the Input Toolbox drawer (this is a drop-down menu choice of the 'on shake' block) to advance to the next word when we tilt the micro:bit down.
trans-unit.target: We can do this by changing the index of 配列 with the 'on screen down' イベントハンドラー from the 入力(Input)メニュー (this is a ドロップダウン メニュー choice of the 'on shake' block) to advance to the next word when we tilt the micro:bit down.

trans-unit.source: We have a limited number of elements in our array, so to avoid an error, we need to check and make sure we are not already at the end of the array before we change the index.
trans-unit.target: We have a limited number of elements in our array, so to avoid an error, we need to check and make sure we are not already at the end of 配列 before we change the index.

trans-unit.source: Under the Arrays Toolbox drawer, drag out a 'length of' block. The 'length of' block returns the number of items (elements) in an array. For our array, the length of block will return the value 6.
trans-unit.target: Under the 配列(Arrays)メニュー, drag out a 「配列の長さ（length of）」 block. The 「配列の長さ（length of）」 block returns the number of items (elements) in 配列. For our array, the length of block will return 値 6.

trans-unit.source:
But because computer programmers start counting at zero, the index of the final (6th) element is 5.
Some pseudocode for our algorithm logic:
trans-unit.target:
But because computer programmers start counting at zero, the index of the final (6th) element is 5.
Some pseudocode for our algorithm logic:

trans-unit.source: When the player places the micro:bit screen down: >Check the current value of the index.
trans-unit.target: When the player places the micro:bit screen down: >Check the current value of the index.

trans-unit.source:
>> If: the current value of the index is less than the length of the array minus one (see array bounds note),
Then: change the value of the index by one,
Else: indicate that it is the end of the game.
trans-unit.target:
>> If: the current value of the index is less than the length of 配列 minus one (see array bounds note),
Then: change の値 the index by one,
Else: indicate that it is the end of the game.

trans-unit.source: ~hint
trans-unit.target: ~hint

trans-unit.source: Array bounds
trans-unit.target: Array bounds

trans-unit.source: Our array has a length 6, so this will mean that as long as the current value of the index is less than 5, we will change the array by one.
trans-unit.target: Our array has a length 6, so this will mean that as long as the current value of the index is less than 5, we will change 配列 by one.

trans-unit.source: Using ‘less than the length of the array minus one’ instead of the actual numbers for our array makes this code more flexible and easier to maintain.
trans-unit.target: Using ‘less than the length of 配列 minus one’ instead of the actual numbers for our array makes this code more flexible and easier to maintain.

trans-unit.source: We can easily add more elements to our array and not have to worry about changing numbers elsewhere in the code.
trans-unit.target: We can easily add more elements to our array and not have to worry about changing numbers elsewhere in the code.

trans-unit.source: We can put this all together with an 'if...then...else' block and a 'less than' comparison block from the Logic Toolbox drawer, a subtraction block from the Math Toolbox drawer, and a 'game over' block from the Game Toolbox drawer (located under the Advanced menu).
trans-unit.target: We can put this all together with an 「もし・・・なら・・・でなければ（if...then...else）」 block and a 「（less than）」comparison block from the 論理(Logic)メニュー, 足し算ブロック from the 計算(Math)メニュー, and a 'game over' block from the ゲーム(Game)メニュー (located under the 高度なブロック(Advanced)メニュー).

trans-unit.source: To make our game more polished, we’ll add 2 more blocks for smoother game play.
trans-unit.target: To make our game more polished, we’ll add 2 more blocks for smoother game play.

trans-unit.source: In case a word is already scrolling on the screen when a player places the micro:bit screen down, we can stop this animation and clear the screen for the next word by using a 'stop animation' block from the Led More Toolbox drawer, and a 'clear screen' block from the Basic More Toolbox drawer.
trans-unit.target: In case a word is already scrolling on 画面 when a player places the micro:bit screen down, we can stop this animation and clear 画面 for the next word by using a 「アニメーションを停止（stop animation）」 block from the LED -> さらに表示 メニュー, and a 'clear screen' block from the 基本（Basic）-> さらに表示 メニュー.

trans-unit.source: Game Play
trans-unit.target: Game Play

trans-unit.source: There are different ways you can play charades with our program. Here is one way you can play with a group of friends.
trans-unit.target: There are different ways you can play charades with our program. Here is one way you can play with a group of friends.

trans-unit.source: With the micro:bit on and held so Player A cannot see the screen, another player starts the program to see the first word.
trans-unit.target: With the micro:bit on and held so プレイヤーA cannot see 画面, another player starts the program to see the first word.

trans-unit.source: The other players act out this word charades-style for Player A to guess.
trans-unit.target: The other players act out this word charades-style for プレイヤーA to guess.

trans-unit.source: When Player A guesses correctly or decides to pass on this word, a player places the micro:bit screen down.
trans-unit.target: When プレイヤーA guesses correctly or decides to pass on this word, a player places the micro:bit screen down.

trans-unit.source: When ready for the next word, a player turns the micro:bit screen up. Play continues until all the words in the array have been used.
trans-unit.target: When ready for the next word, a player turns the micro:bit screen up. Play continues until all the words in 配列 have been used.

trans-unit.source: Mod this!
trans-unit.target: Mod this!

trans-unit.source: Add a headband to hold the micro:bit on the Players' foreheads (using cardboard, paper, rubber bands, etc.)
trans-unit.target: Add a headband to hold the micro:bit on the Players' foreheads (using cardboard, paper, rubber bands, etc.)

trans-unit.source: Add a way to keep score
trans-unit.target: Add a way to keep score

trans-unit.source: Keep track of the number of correct guesses and passes
trans-unit.target: Keep track of the number of correct guesses and passes

trans-unit.source:
Add a time limit
Headband Charades Complete Program (simple version - no time limit or scoring):
trans-unit.target:
Add a time limit
Headband Charades Complete Program (simple version - no time limit or scoring):

trans-unit.source: .`) basic.pause(100) basic.showNumber(3) basic.pause(100) basic.showNumber(2) basic.pause(100) basic.showNumber(1) basic.showString(arrayWords[index])
trans-unit.target: .`) basic.pause(100) basic.showNumber(3) basic.pause(100) basic.showNumber(2) basic.pause(100) basic.showNumber(1) basic.showString(arrayWords[index])

trans-unit.source: /static/courses/csintro/arrays/starry-night.gif
trans-unit.target: /static/courses/csintro/arrays/starry-night.gif

trans-unit.source: Random stars
trans-unit.target: Random stars

trans-unit.source: Activity: Starry starry night
trans-unit.target: アクティビティ: Starry starry night

trans-unit.source: In this micro:bit activity, we will create a set of random constellations on the micro:bit screen.
trans-unit.target: In this micro:bit アクティビティ, we will create a set of random constellations on the micro:bit screen.

trans-unit.source: We will use an array filled with numbers to tell us how many stars (dots) should be in each constellation.
trans-unit.target: We will use 配列 filled with numbers to tell us how many stars (dots) should be in each constellation.

trans-unit.source: Review the use of the random block in the Math category.
trans-unit.target: Review the use of the random block in the Math category.

trans-unit.source: Create a block that will plot a single dot at a random location on the screen by choosing a random number from 0 to 4 for the x axis and a random number from 0 to 4 for the y axis.
trans-unit.target: Create ブロック that will plot a single dot at a random location on 画面 by choosing a random number from 0 to 4 for the x axis and a random number from 0 to 4 for the y axis.

trans-unit.source: led.plot(Math.random(5), Math.random(5))
trans-unit.target: led.plot(Math.random(5), Math.random(5))

trans-unit.source: Next, let’s create a loop that will repeat the above code five times, for a constellation with five stars.
trans-unit.target: Next, let’s create a loop that will repeat the above code five times, for a constellation with five stars.

trans-unit.source: Note that to keep things simple we don’t check for duplicates, so it’s possible you may end up with fewer than five visible stars. That’s okay.
trans-unit.target: Note that to keep things simple we don’t check for duplicates, so it’s possible you may end up with fewer than five visible stars. That’s okay.

trans-unit.source: Next, let’s create an array with five numbers in it.
trans-unit.target: Next, let’s create 配列 with five numbers in it.

trans-unit.source: We will loop through the array and create five separate constellations, using the numbers in the array to represent the number of stars in each of the five constellations.
trans-unit.target: We will loop through 配列 and create five separate constellations, using the numbers in 配列 to represent the number of stars in each of the five constellations.

trans-unit.source: To create an array, you need to set the value of a variable to the array.
trans-unit.target: To create 配列, you need to set の値 変数 to 配列.

trans-unit.source: From the Variables Toolbox drawer, drag out the ‘set item’ block and attach a ‘create array with number’ block to it.
trans-unit.target: From the 変数(Variables)メニュー, drag out the 「変数を・・・にする（set item）」ブロック and attach a 「この値で配列を作成（create array with number）」 block to it.

trans-unit.source: Then click on the blue Gear icon and add four more values to the block, for a total of five.
trans-unit.target: Then click on the blue Gear icon and add four more values to the block, for a total of five.

trans-unit.source: /static/courses/csintro/arrays/gear-values.png
trans-unit.target: /static/courses/csintro/arrays/gear-values.png

trans-unit.source: Gear icon on array block
trans-unit.target: Gear icon on 配列ブロック

trans-unit.source: You can put the Gear view away by clicking on the Gear again.
trans-unit.target: You can put the Gear view away by clicking on the Gear again.

trans-unit.source: You can drag additional numbers out of the Math category and snap them to the open slots in the Create array with block.
trans-unit.target: You can drag additional numbers out of the Math category and snap them to the open slots in the Create array with block.

trans-unit.source: Go ahead and change them to some random values, then attach the whole thing to the ‘on start’ event handler block.
trans-unit.target: Go ahead and change them to some random values, then attach the whole thing to the 「最初だけ（on start）」 イベントハンドラー block.

trans-unit.source: Now, when the micro:bit starts, it will create an array with those five values.
trans-unit.target: Now, when the micro:bit starts, it will create 配列 with those five values.

trans-unit.source: Let’s create the constellations when the A button is pressed.
trans-unit.target: Let’s create the constellations when Aボタン is pressed.

trans-unit.source: Looking at our loop, instead of repeating 0 to 4 times, we actually want to use the value from the array to figure out how many stars to create.
trans-unit.target: Looking at our loop, instead of repeating 0 to 4 times, we actually want to use 値 from 配列 to figure out how many stars to create.

trans-unit.source: Drag the ‘get value from list’ block from the Arrays Toolbox drawer and replace the 4 with that block.
trans-unit.target: Drag the ‘get value from list’ block from the 配列(Arrays)メニュー and replace the 4 with that block.

trans-unit.source: You should see that there are more stars printed now, although there is an extra star; if the first value in the array is 5, you will actually see 6 stars because the loop runs when index is 0.
trans-unit.target: You should see that there are more stars printed now, although there is an extra star; if the first value in 配列 is 5, you will actually see 6 stars because the loop runs when index is 0.

trans-unit.source: To fix this, we need to do a little math by subtracting 1 from whatever the value in the array is. You can use a Math operation block to do this.
trans-unit.target: To fix this, we need to do a little math by subtracting 1 from whatever 値 in 配列 is. You can use a Math operation block to do this.

trans-unit.source: Note: Be sure to hit Refresh a few times on the simulator, because sometimes some stars get hidden behind other stars.
trans-unit.target: Note: Be sure to hit Refresh a few times on シミュレーター, because sometimes some stars get hidden behind other stars.

trans-unit.source: The above code takes the first value in the array and creates that many stars at random locations.
trans-unit.target: The above code takes the first value in 配列 and creates that many stars at random locations.

trans-unit.source: Now, all we need to do is iterate through the entire array and do the same thing for each of the values.
trans-unit.target: Now, all we need to do is iterate through the entire array and do the same thing for each of 値.

trans-unit.source: We will put the above code inside another loop that will run the same number of times as the length of the array (in this case, 5).
trans-unit.target: We will put the above code inside another loop that will run the same number of times as the length of 配列 (in this case, 5).

trans-unit.source: You should also use a 'pause' block and a 'clear screen' block in between each constellation.
trans-unit.target: You should also use a 「一時停止（pause）」 block and a 「表示を消す（clear screen）」 block in between each constellation.

trans-unit.source: Finally, you might attach the code that shows the constellations to an 'on button A pressed' event handler.
trans-unit.target: Finally, you might attach the code that shows the constellations to an 「ボタンAが押されたとき（on button A pressed）」 イベントハンドラー.

trans-unit.source: Here is the complete program.
trans-unit.target: こちらが完全なプログラムです。

trans-unit.source: Traversing an array
trans-unit.target: Traversing 配列

trans-unit.source: Traversing an array means proceeding through the elements of the array in sequence.
trans-unit.target: Traversing 配列 means proceeding through the elements of 配列 in sequence.

trans-unit.source: Note that there is a special loop in the Loops Toolbox drawer called ‘for element value of list’.
trans-unit.target: Note that there is a special loop in the ループ(Loops)メニュー called 「配列の値を変数に入れてくりかえす（for element value of list）」.

trans-unit.source: This loop automatically takes each element of your array in turn and copies it into a variable called value.
trans-unit.target: This loop automatically takes each element of your array in turn and copies it into 変数 called value.

trans-unit.source:
for (let index = 0; index <= 4; index++){
}
trans-unit.target:
for (let index = 0; index <= 4; index++){
}

trans-unit.source: The following code is useful for printing out the values of the elements in your array:
trans-unit.target: The following code is useful for printing out の値 the elements in your array:

trans-unit.source: However, note that value holds a copy of the element in the array, so changing value doesn’t affect the original element.
trans-unit.target: However, note that value holds a copy of the element in 配列, so changing value doesn’t affect the original element.

trans-unit.source: If you run the code below, then print out the array again, you will see that it is unchanged.
trans-unit.target: If you run the code below, then print out 配列 again, you will see that it is unchanged.
